title: “When I grow up, I want to be Jordan Peterson.”  A Technology Guru discusses Truth and Meaning
description:
Neil Mammen

Title:  “When I grow up, I want to be Jordan Peterson.”  A Technology Guru on Truth and Meaning
Graduate of Oregon State University
Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Solid State

Engineering Physicist with 16 patents
Very first mpeg encoders, mp3 players, set top boxes, 
Network Processing
Consultant in quantum computing and holographic processing
Dad was a professor in physics who believed there are only two reasons you don’t learn
1)  you’re not interested
2)  you’ve had bad instruction
Important to see all the connections. Time and interest are required to come up to speed.
Born in Ghana, grew up in Sudan, Yemen, parents are from India

Extra dimensional thinking
Michio Kaku believes there are other spatial dimensions. 
Complex numbers have exactly half as many dimensions

You are not your brain. You are not your body. You don’t have a soul.
You are a soul. What you have is a body.

Is the brain an interface to the soul? If it is, perhaps the Right hemisphere is the connection.
Logic and reason have always existed. 
We are a subset of reality. 
Ontology: What is? Epistemology: And how do we know what is?
Princess Bride:  Reality bites. As you wish.
Utopian thinkers want to force reality to meet their expectations.

God is outside the universe, but outside does not mean apart from, as a 3 dimensional creature is not apart from a 2 dimensional creature. It’s just that the 2 dimensional creature would be completely unaware of the 3 dimensional creature because it could only see what is on its plane. God is omnidimensional and omnipresent.

Godel’s Incompleteness Theorem. There are things we know that we can’t know from within the system. Logic and reason presuppose logic and reason. 
Charles Darwin and JBS Haldane

Jordan Peterson and his perspective of Truth.
“When I grow up, I want to be Jordan Peterson.”

How do we know that truth exists?
A suicide statement is a statement which refutes itself as soon as it is uttered.
Examples:  My brother was an only child.   Never say never.   There is no truth.

Some things are necessarily true. They would be true whether or not this universe existed.
Examples:  Mathematics, Set Theory, Logic, Truth statements (example: if there were no universe, the statement “There is no universe” would be true.)

That which is true whether or not this universe exists is a Transcendent truth.

Next time, we will discuss Big Bang Theory, Cosmology, Quantum Computing, holographic processing, and Who is Agent X?

Proving God exists without using the Bible:
http://www.amazon.com/dp/1448626196/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_til?tag=jesisinvinpol-20&camp=14573&creative=327641&linkCode=as1&creativeASIN=1448626196&adid=11NJB21RS8HQR0KQFMFM&

Quotes from Iain McGilchrist essay, The Divided Brain

“But the most curious aspect of the story of the left hemisphere is yet to come. It turns on how a self-consistent system of signs, such as the left hemisphere's world, can come to seem more real than the lived world itself.”

“The ideal, theoretical world begins to triumph over that of experience.”

“…What is fascinating is the rationalistic left hemisphere's conclusion: not that this kind of logic has its limits in understanding the world, but that the experiential world somehow doesn't measure up to logic.”

Eric Weinstein Portal conversation with Roger Penrose
https://podtail.com/en/podcast/the-portal/20-sir-roger-penrose-plotting-the-twist-of-einstei/

Iain McGilchrist essay
https://www.amazon.com/Divided-Brain-Search-Meaning-ebook/dp/B008JE7I2M/ref=sr_1_3?keywords=The+Divided+Brain&qid=1580331472&sr=8-3

N. T. Wright essay
https://www.firstthings.com/article/2020/02/loving-to-know

Neil’s book on politics: www.JesusIsInvolvedInPolitics.com
Neil’s apologetics website: www.NoBlindFaith.com

Karen's art website:  www.karenwongart.com
Karen's Jordan Peterson blog:  www.TheMeaningCode.com
